title: Princess Latifa: Dubai photo appears to show missing woman
description: The Emirati princess has been imprisoned in Dubai since she tried to escape in 2018.

title: Mount Nyiragongo: DR Congo plans to evacuate city as volcano erupts
description: Residents of Goma flee to safety as nearby Mount Nyiragongo throws huge lava fountains into the air.

title: Covid: India tells social media firms to remove 'India variant' from content
description: Platforms are told to take down all content that refers to an "Indian variant" of the coronavirus.

title: Israel-Palestinian conflict: Eyes on peace options as Gaza truce holds
description: Mediators try to cement the truce, as Israel and Palestinian militants take stock of an 11-day conflict.

title: China's Zhurong rover takes first drive on Mars
description: China is now the second country after the US to operate a rover on the Red Planet.

title: French army chief says UN report into air strike was biased
description: Gen Lecointre says he believes Europe will still be fighting jihadism in the Sahel in 10 years time.

title: Bayern Munich 5-2 Augsburg: Robert Lewandowski breaks goalscoring record
description: Robert Lewandowski scores in the final minute of the season for Bayern Munich to break Gerd Muller's 49-year record of goals in a Bundesliga campaign.

title: Myanmar coup: Junta head claims Aung San Suu Kyi 'in good health'
description: Min Aung Hlaing makes the claim in his first interview since seizing power in February.

title: Covid: Argentina starts new lockdown as cases soar
description: The country that endured one of the world's longest quarantines is back under restrictions.

title: Salmonella: CDC urges Americans not to kiss chickens amid outbreak
description: The US public health agency asks people to be careful around live poultry after a multi-state outbreak.

title: Einstein handwritten letter with equation fetches $1.2m
description: The rare handwritten example of his most famous equation sells for three times more than expected.

title: Nigerian army chief Ibrahim Attahiru killed in air crash
description: The incident happened as the plane was trying to land in bad weather in Kaduna state, the military says.

title: Gaza-Israel conflict in pictures: 11 days of destruction
description: People in Gaza and Israel assess the damage to their homes and cities after 11 days of fighting.

title: From beer to Tinder boosts: The bribes for people to get jabbed
description: Free beer, marijuana and Tinder boosts are among the incentives being offered - but do they work?

title: Over 3,000 fans will attend the final of this year's Eurovision Song Contest
description: After being cancelled and replaced by an online 'event' last year, the competition is back on and welcoming over 3,000 fans to the live show.

title: Myanmar: The small embattled town that stood up to the army
description: Mindat put up tenacious resistance to the Burmese army but is now in desperate need of help.

title: George Floyd death: How US police are trying to win back trust
description: A year after George Floyd's death, it's not just civilians who'll be reflecting on what happened.

title: Covid Vaccines: Could they be magnetic?
description: Videos of people sticking magnets to their arms where they claim they’ve had the Covid vaccine have gone viral. We debunk this so-called magnet challenge.

title: Coronavirus: How Covid-19 crushed India's healthcare systems
description: Experts say Covid-19 has exposed the inadequacies of India's healthcare infrastructure.

title: Water so toxic 'it could burn your eyes'
description: Martin Patience gets to the source of Lebanon's water crisis.

title: Five decades of Eurovision songs... from memory
description: The BBC's Steve Rosenberg returns to delight you with his piano renditions and encyclopaedic knowledge of the Eurovision Song Contest.

title: Israel-Gaza: How children on both sides experienced the conflict
description: The BBC talks to children on both sides of the Israel-Gaza conflict about their experiences.

title: Palestinians and Israelis react to ceasefire
description: Whilst Palestinians took to the streets to celebrate, reaction from Israelis was more subdued.
